definition: dog's leg/fig. one who follows a villain/henchman/hired thug

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: the mainstream civil-rights leaders whom Malcolm denounced as “stooges” and “lackeys.
sentences.chinese: 而馬爾科姆則斥責他們爲“走狗”和“狗腿子”。

sentences.english: I am convinced the other captives are flunkies and maybe snitches.
sentences.chinese: 我確信其它俘虜都是狗腿子或告密者。

sentences.english: This " henchman " came from a poor family in the countryside with a lot of younger brothers and sisters.
sentences.chinese: “狗腿子”家在農村，兄弟姐妹一大堆，純屬困難戶。

definition: a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
(Wu dialect) bum/wretched-looking tramp who lives by begging or stealing
(derog.) inept advisor/a good-for-nothing adviser/one who offers bad advice
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
to hang on to and serve the rich and powerful by literary hack work etc
